009package imagingbook.spectral.fd;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.mod;
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013import static java.lang.Math.PI;
014import static java.lang.Math.cos;
015import static java.lang.Math.sin;
016import static java.lang.Math.sqrt;
017
018import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
019import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
020import imagingbook.common.math.Complex;
021
022
023/**
024 * Defines static methods to create Fourier descriptors
025 * directly from 2D polygons without re-sampling or interpolation.
026 * 
027 * @author WB
028 * @version 2022/10/24
029 */
030public abstract class FourierDescriptorTrigonometric {
031        
032        private FourierDescriptorTrigonometric() {}
033        
034        /**
035         * Creates a {@link FourierDescriptor} directly from
036         * the vertices of a closed polygon (without interpolation).
037         * For a given number (mp) of Fourier coefficient pairs,
038         * the resulting number of Fourier coefficients is M = 2 * mp + 1.
039         * 
040         * @param V sequence of 2D points representing a closed polygon
041         * @param mp the number of Fourier coefficient pairs (arbitrary)
042         * @return a new {@link FourierDescriptorTrigonometric} instance
043         */
044        public static FourierDescriptor from(Pnt2d[] V, int mp) {
045                Complex[] G = makeDftSpectrumTrigonometric(Utils.toComplexArray(V), mp);
046                return new FourierDescriptor(G);
047        }
048
049        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
050        
051        private static Complex[] makeDftSpectrumTrigonometric(Complex[] g, int mp) {
052                final int N = g.length;                         // number of polygon vertices
053                final int M = 2 * mp + 1;                       // number of Fourier coefficients (always odd)
054                final double[] dx = new double[N];              // dx[k] is the delta-x for polygon segment <k,k+1>
055                final double[] dy = new double[N];              // dy[k] is the delta-y for polygon segment <k,k+1>
056                final double[] lambda = new double[N];  // lambda[k] is the length of the polygon segment <k,k+1>
057                final double[] L  = new double[N + 1];  // T[k] is the cumulated path length at polygon vertex k in [0,K]
058        
059        Complex[] G = new Complex[M];
060        
061        L[0] = 0;
062        for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {   // compute Dx, Dy, Dt and t tables
063            dx[i] = g[(i + 1) % N].re - g[i].re;
064            dy[i] = g[(i + 1) % N].im - g[i].im;
065            lambda[i] = sqrt(sqr(dx[i]) + sqr(dy[i]));  // TODO: use hypot()
066            if (Arithmetic.isZero(lambda[i])) {
067                        throw new Error("zero-length polygon segment!");
068                }
069            L[i+1] = L[i] + lambda[i];
070        }
071        
072        double Ln = L[N];       // Ln is the closed polygon length
073               
074        // calculate DFT coefficient G[0]:
075        double x0 = g[0].re; // V[0].getX();
076        double y0 = g[0].im; // V[0].getY();
077        double a0 = 0;
078        double c0 = 0;
079        for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {   // for each polygon vertex
080                double s = (sqr(L[i+1]) - sqr(L[i])) / (2 * lambda[i]) - L[i];
081                double xi = g[i].re; // V[i].getX();
082                double yi = g[i].im; // V[i].getY();
083                a0 = a0 + s * dx[i] + (xi - x0) * lambda[i];
084                c0 = c0 + s * dy[i] + (yi - y0) * lambda[i];
085        }
086        //G[0] = new Complex(x0 + a0/Ln, y0 + c0/Ln);
087        setCoefficient(G, 0, new Complex(x0 + a0/Ln, y0 + c0/Ln));
088        
089        // calculate remaining FD pairs G[-m], G[+m] for m = 1,...,Mp
090        for (int m = 1; m <= mp; m++) { // for each FD pair
091                double w = 2 * PI * m / Ln;
092                double a = 0, c = 0;
093                double b = 0, d = 0;
094            for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {       //      for each polygon vertex
095                double w0 = w * L[i];                           
096                double w1 = w * L[(i + 1) % N];         
097                double dCos = cos(w1) - cos(w0);
098                a = a + dCos * (dx[i] / lambda[i]);
099                c = c + dCos * (dy[i] / lambda[i]);
100                double dSin = sin(w1) - sin(w0);
101                b = b + dSin * (dx[i] / lambda[i]);
102                d = d + dSin * (dy[i] / lambda[i]);
103            }
104            double s = Ln / sqr(2 * PI * m);
105            setCoefficient(G, +m, new Complex(s * (a + d), s * (c - b)));
106            setCoefficient(G, -m, new Complex(s * (a - d), s * (b + c)));
107        }
108        
109        return G;
110        }
111        
112        private static void setCoefficient(Complex[] C, int m, Complex z) {
113                C[mod(m, C.length)] = z;
114        }
115//      private static void setCoefficient(Complex[] G, int m, Complex z) {
116//              int mm = Arithmetic.mod(m, G.length);
117//              G[mm] = new Complex(z);
118//      }
119
120}
